issues: Lack of consistent bullet point usage.
Missing location information (city, country) for competitions.
suggestions: Standardize date formats (e.g., MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM).
Use consistent bullet points throughout, especially within job descriptions.
Add location information to each competition to provide context.

strengths: Quantifiable achievement in the hackathon (7th place).
Clear demonstration of web development skills through the IndabaX website.
weaknesses: Limited evidence of server-side development experience directly aligned with the job description.
Beginner level in Machine Learning/Deep Learning, which is not emphasized in the job description.
Lack of projects demonstrating database management skills (SQL schema design, optimization).
suggestions: Highlight any personal projects or coursework involving server-side technologies mentioned in the job description (Node.js, Django, Spring Boot). Even small projects can demonstrate initiative.
Include quantifiable metrics related to the IndabaX website development, such as website traffic or user engagement.
Create a small personal project involving a database and API integration to showcase relevant skills. Describe this project in the 'Selected Projects' section.

general.summary: The CV showcases web development and problem-solving skills but needs stronger evidence of server-side development and database management experience to align with the job description. Prioritizing relevant skills and adding demonstrable experience will significantly improve its impact.
top_priorities: Highlight server-side development experience (even small projects).
Demonstrate database management skills through a relevant project.
Tailor the 'Skills' section to emphasize technologies mentioned in the job description, showcasing depth over breadth.
